intro: Hieracium dimoniei, commonly known as the Siberian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Siberia and northern Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are generally basal, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow or pale yellow in color. Hieracium dimoniei is often found in open habitats such as tundra and grasslands, where it thrives in cooler climates.
